ocr_mistral.text:
GENERAL AFFIDAVIT

State of , County of , ss:

In the matter of

ON THIS day of , A. D. 18 , personally

appeared before me in and for the afore-

said County, duly authorized to administer oaths

aged , years, a resident of , in the County

of , and State of

whose Post-office address is

, aged years, a resident of

, in the County of

and State of , whose Post-office address is

well known to be reputable and entitled to credit, and who, being duly sworn, declared in relation to aforesaid

case as follows:

(NOTE.—Affiants should state how they gain a knowledge of the facts to which they testify.)

My claim against the U.S. is for three

years services as Nurse and cook

in hospitals, and as commander

of General Men (Eight or Nine) as scouts

during the late war of the Rebellion

under directions and orders of Edwin

M. Stanton Secretary of War, and of

several Generals.

I claim for my services above named

the sum of Eighteen hundred dollars.

The annexed copies have recently been

read over to me and are true to the

best of my knowledge information

and belief.

I further declare that I have no interest in said case and am

not concerned in its prosecution. and allowance.

Dan M. Carty

M. Elsie McCarty

(If Affiants sign by mark, two witnesses who write sign here.)

Harriet Harris

Sate Harriet Tubman

(Signatures of Affiants.)

transcribe_handwriting.text:
My dear Agant The U.S. is for three years paid no more and could
not emploee me to commisary. I am the comander
of Journal 8 (eight a Man) as Regt.
During the late war of Rebellion.
render directions and orders of Edison.
Medison Secretary of War and of
several Generals.
I claiming my services above named
the sum of Eighteen hundred dollars.
The aredafel copies have mostly been
read over to me and are true to the
best of my knowledge information
and belief.

I further declare that I have no interest in said case and am
not concerned in its prosecution and allowance.

Owen H. Charlet
W. Elsie Mc North

(x) Harriet Tubman
Late Harriet Tubman
her mark

pages.annotated_text:
GENERAL AFFIDAVIT

State of <hw>New York</hw>, County of <hw>Auburn</hw>, ss:

In the matter of

ON THIS <hw>24th</hw> day of <hw>February</hw>, A. D. 18<hw>94</hw>, personally

appeared before me in and for the afore-

said County, duly authorized to administer oaths

aged <hw>73</hw>, years, a resident of <hw>Auburn</hw>, in the County

of <hw>Cayuga</hw>, and State of <hw>New York</hw>

whose Post-office address is <hw>329 South Street</hw>

<hw>Harriet Tubman</hw>, aged <hw>73</hw> years, a resident of

<hw>Auburn</hw>, in the County of <hw>Cayuga</hw>

and State of <hw>New York</hw>, whose Post-office address is <hw>329 South Street</hw>

well known to be reputable and entitled to credit, and who, being duly sworn, declared in relation to aforesaid

case as follows:

(NOTE.—Affiants should state how they gain a knowledge of the facts to which they testify.)

<hw>My claim against The U.S. is for three</hw>

<hw>years services as Nurse and cook</hw>

<hw>in hospitals, and as commander</hw>

<hw>of General Men (Eight or Nine) as scouts</hw>

<hw>during the late war of the Rebellion</hw>

<hw>under directions and orders of Edwin</hw>

<hw>M. Stanton Secretary of War, and of</hw>

<hw>several Generals.</hw>

<hw>I claim for my services above named</hw>

<hw>the sum of Eighteen hundred dollars.</hw>

<hw>The annexed copies have recently been</hw>

<hw>read over to me and are true to the</hw>

<hw>best of my knowledge information</hw>

<hw>and belief.</hw>

I further declare that <hw>I have no</hw> interest in said case and <hw>am</hw>

not concerned in its prosecution. and allowance.

<hw>Dan M. Carty</hw>

<hw>M. Elsie McCarty</hw>

(If Affiants sign by mark, two witnesses who write sign here.)

<hw>Harriet Harris</hw>

<hw>Sate Harriet Tubman</hw>

(Signatures of Affiants.)
